Certainly! Here's an example:

The 1901 book 'From the Earth to the Moon,' written by Jules Verne, predicted the use of a space gun to launch a spacecraft into orbit. While Verne's book was purely fictional, it was based on scientific principles of the time and it accurately predicted many aspects of space travel that would later come to fruition.

In particular, Verne imagined launching a spacecraft to the moon using a giant cannon, which would propel it through the vacuum of space. While the technology to build such a cannon did not exist at the time, Verne's book helped inspire many scientists and engineers to work on the development of rockets and with time, the concept of a giant cannon was transformed into rocket technology that propelled the first manned mission to the moon in 1969.

So in summary, while 'From the Earth to the Moon' was a work of fiction, it accurately predicted a future technology development - the use of rocket propulsion in space travel.
